#Text=CHAPTER 7
#Text=For some reason or other , the house was crowded that night , and the fat Jew manager who met them at the door was beaming from ear to ear with an oily tremulous smile .
#Text=He escorted them to their box with a sort of pompous humility , waving his fat jewelled hands and talking at the top of his voice .
#Text=Dorian Gray loathed him more than ever .
#Text=He felt as if he had come to look for Miranda and had been met by Caliban .
#Text=Lord Henry , upon the other hand , rather liked him .
#Text=At least he declared he did , and insisted on shaking him by the hand and assuring him that he was proud to meet a man who had discovered a real genius and gone bankrupt over a poet .
#Text=Hallward amused himself with watching the faces in the pit .
#Text=The heat was terribly oppressive , and the huge sunlight flamed like a monstrous dahlia with petals of yellow fire .
#Text=The youths in the gallery had taken off their coats and waistcoats and hung them over the side .
#Text=They talked to each other across the theatre and shared their oranges with the tawdry girls who sat beside them .
#Text=Some women were laughing in the pit .
#Text=Their voices were horribly shrill and discordant .
#Text=The sound of the popping of corks came from the bar .
#Text=" What a place to find one 's divinity in ! " said Lord Henry .
#Text=" Yes ! " answered Dorian Gray .
#Text=" It was here I found her , and she is divine beyond all living things .

#Text=Then the curtain rises , and you will see the girl to whom I am going to give all my life , to whom I have given everything that is good in me .
